intro: Cyclopogon williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' cyclopogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant produces a cluster of small, green, fleshy berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
